{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3584679,"name":null,"username":"NJ4611","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T01:35:28.348Z","cooked":"

Hi, I am a programmer for team 4611 and am considering ways to improve our team’s software preseason training. Currently we do not teach object oriented programming in our preseason training because of the limited amount of meetings during that time. Instead we focus on trying to teach more frc oriented stuff during meetings and trusting students to learn the basics of oop on their own, which I thought would be especially easy this year since we swapped to python, a language with a lot of online learning resources, this year. However, I notice that a lot of our new programmers tend to not learn any of the basic python things they need to and as such struggle with the actual frc things. So I am just wondering how other teams handle teaching oop to new students if so at all?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T01:35:28.348Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":476,"readers_count":475,"score":180.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75029,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3584681,"name":"","username":"TheComputer314","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecomputer314/{size}/241453_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T01:38:20.157Z","cooked":"

FRC programming tends to be more functional programming than OOP, especially the Commands framework. They only really need to learn the basic syntax before diving into FRC specific knowledge like how to use the Commands framework.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T01:38:20.157Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":431,"readers_count":430,"score":136.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62207,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The one crazy dude on 167"},"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/2","custom_user_title":"The one crazy dude on 167","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584689,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T01:42:41.602Z","cooked":"

Yes, we focus on OOP from the end of the season (now) until about halfway through the fall training period (using online learning methods like Code Academy in addition to in-person programming practice/teaching), then spend the later half of preseason (Oct-December) on robot-specific frameworks and controls.
This week is a great time to get started on programming training for the 2026 season!

When do you start your off season?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T02:00:32.689Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":282,"readers_count":281,"score":61.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6078,"username":"seg9585","name":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63182,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Student Programmer | 4611"},"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/4","custom_user_title":"Student Programmer | 4611","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584790,"name":"MetabolicCloth","username":"MetabolicCloth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/metaboliccloth/{size}/9335_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T02:59:19.412Z","cooked":"

Agreed, OOP concepts are introduced much later in the season. I spend most of my pre-season training teaching WPILIB concepts rather than Java concepts. They can pick up a variable or an if statement pretty quickly. So the focus is on interfacing with hardware, triggers, commands, etc. along with FRC tools like DS, AScope, or PathPlanner.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T02:59:19.412Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":234,"readers_count":233,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"MetabolicCloth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62207,"username":"TheComputer314","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecomputer314/{size}/241453_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584796,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T03:07:24.669Z","cooked":"

A week after regular season ends, so for us we start next Monday.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T03:07:24.669Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":42.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63182,"username":"Akshaj_K","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584809,"name":"Jade","username":"spacey_sooty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/spacey_sooty/{size}/256378_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T03:19:41.436Z","cooked":"

I don’t teach OOP cause I don’t want people taking OOP with them. I’d much rather they take more functional patterns with them which will also serve them much better in an FRC environment. While I think their is some benefit of learning OOP at some point I think its largely an antiquated pattern and new students would be much better off learning more functional programming.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T03:19:41.436Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":79.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"Jade","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60214,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4788 | Choreo | PhotonVision"},"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/7","custom_user_title":"4788 | Choreo | PhotonVision","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584899,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T07:08:51.569Z","cooked":"

We teach the unavoidable stuff (object lifetimes, scope, etc), but never hit stuff like inheritance. Inheritance is really just… suboptimal, and if we do get to that level of library management deep dives, I’m teaching them composition, generics, and interfaces.

Whenever possible, I also try to drive them toward a more functional style, as well as results and optionals rather than oop-style nulls and exception handling.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T07:08:51.569Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/8","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584952,"name":"Jainish Patel","username":"JaiCodes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaicodes/{size}/203987_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T11:37:51.888Z","cooked":"

At 4065 we briefly cover OOP as conceptual rather than syntactical in the beginning of the school year. From what I see, students learn faster on how to implement whole subsystems and connect things such as attributes to motors and sensors, methods to behaviors of the subsystem, etc. We then teach OOP fully at the end of the competition season since we want our students to be prepared for the future and teach them the full Java language outside of WPILib. (Also because of our scouting app is built using Java too lol)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T11:37:51.888Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":24.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":"Jainish Patel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4065 NOP | Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/9","custom_user_title":"4065 NOP | Programming Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3585047,"name":null,"username":"NJ4611","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T13:48:19.076Z","cooked":"

Thank you all so much for your responses. I probably should’ve clarified what I meant by teaching oop. I was thinking of just teaching them python syntax and oop principles relating to that such as classes and inheritance (since that is what relates to frc the most imo) instead of having them learning it on their own.

My main concern however is that I feel like there isn’t much that the team can teach in terms of basic python that they can’t learn from a 15 minute youtube tutorial and just showing a video to them feels like a waste of everyone’s time. Also we start our preseason relatively late and don’t make any of those meetings mandatory so it would be really difficult to keep track of who knows what.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T13:48:19.076Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498529,"topic_slug":"does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75029,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/does-your-team-teach-oop-to-new-students/498529/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3585098,"name":"Andrew Todd","username":"Andrew123ast","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew123ast/{size}/243883_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T14:40:42.352Z","cooked":"

Should probably cover the basics. Don’t need to go super in-depth.

we just teach em how to code, usually using resources like W3 Schools to get them started. we don’t use command based either
